title: Business & Finance
text:
New regulatory actions in China rattled investors, hammering big tech stocks and fueling a fresh crash in the shares of firms that organize online and in-person tutoring for Chinese schoolchildren.

---

Bitcoin jumped to a six-week high, with some investors attributing the rally to short positions being liquidated and speculation that Amazon may be venturing into digital currencies.

---

Intel CEO Gelsinger laid out a plan to introduce at least a new central processing unit every year between 2021 and 2025.

---

Tesla generated a record quarterly profit as the company largely sidestepped the effects of a chip shortage that has constricted production for many auto makers.

---

Shares of Lucid climbed 11% in their trading debut after the electric-vehicle company completed a blank-check merger.

---

The Dow and S&P 500 both rose 0.2%, while the Nasdaq eked out a 0.03% gain. All three indexes closed at records.

---

Boeing is set on Friday to again launch its Starliner space capsule without crew on board.

---

A judge gave the FTC until Aug. 19 to file an amended version of its antitrust lawsuit against Facebook.
